result.execSummary:
The defendant Mustafaa B Holman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IF REVOKED: Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program nor Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED. All costs, DNA and Buy Money paid in full.
Buy money will be forwarded to the Waukesha Metro Drug Unit.
Maintain full time employment and/or school
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by the Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - First 90 days Huber with release for work, school/and or treatment. Credit for 37 days. Last 6 months stayed for Day Report Center.
Report to huber by 7/21/2017 by 6pm
